moves.2. Nf3 e6 3. d4 b6: As a strategic/positional player, richi02 looks to control a6-f1.
moves.4. a3 Ba6 5. Qc2 Bb7: This adjustment of the bishop proves to be quite valuable latter in the game for richi02.
moves.6. Nc3 Be7 7. e4 d6 8. Bf4 O-O: I love this castle move.  Initially this seems counter-intuitive but proves effective in the course of the game.
moves.9. Bd3 c5 10. e5: If I did not know how the game ends, at this point I would credit baldvin2 with the positional advantage and would foresee baldvin2 winning this match.
moves.10... Nh5 11. Bxh7+: Again, from here I see baldvin2 as emerging victorious at the end of this battle.
moves.11... Kh8 12. Be3 cxd4: Here is where both sides display how their positional development is engineered to win.  (This is where it starts to get good!)
moves.13. exd6 dxc3 14. dxe7 Qxe7 15. Bd3 cxb2: After grinding out 10 captures, each side is equal on points.  Here I would again credit baldvin2 with a positional advantage, but apparently that is not the case.
After regrouping, here is where richi02 makes a brilliant move to shift momentum his way!
moves.22. h3 Qf4 23. Rg3 Nc5: Now baldvin2 is in serious trouble.  I wonder what baldvin2 is thinking at this point?
Epic!  This is quite the display of two strategic warriors dueling to the end!
Why baldvin2 did not smite the rook on f2 is beyond me. (yes I just typed "smite")
moves.39... Nxh3+ 40. Kh1 Rf1+ 41. Kh2 Qd2+: This is where the game hangs in limbo...
